column1: Symptoms may include: - Pain or discomfort in both breasts - Pain that commonly comes and goes with your period, but may last through the whole month - Breasts that feel full, swollen, or heavy - Pain or discomfort under the arms - Thick or lumpy breasts You may have a lump in the same area of the breast that becomes larger before each period and shrinks afterward.
This type of lump is common with fibrocystic breasts.
Women who have no symptoms or only mild symptoms do not need treatment.

Your provider may recommend the following self-care measures: - Take over-the-counter medicine, such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen for pain - Apply heat or ice on the breast - Wear a well-fitting or sports bra Some women believe that eating less fat, caffeine, or chocolate helps with their symptoms.
